data.title: Good breakfast choices
data.text:
Had a delicious breakfast here after scoping out a few recommendations.  Very glad we chose Guru's.
Liked the atmosphere and the friendly greeting.  Spacious and airy, interesting decor.  
Ordered coffee, and split a Cowboy Benny.  Delish!!  Eggs done perfectly and the bacon was not a garnish as I have experienced on some breakfast bennies.  Light and fluffy biscuits with a tasty but not overpowering  sausage (chiorzo?) gravy.
The coffee was fresh, good and strong and we topped off our meal by splitting a large cinnamon bun from the sister bakery.
If we lived there, we'd go back!

data.title: Guru's Means Good Food
data.text: Guru's is a restaurant with a varied menu that combines good flavors and makes reasonably prices meals a pleasure to eat.  The atmosphere is quaint in the old downtown Provo area close to the new Provo City Center LDS Temple.  I recommend it for anyone wanting good food and nice ambiance.

data.title: Good, but disappointed
data.text: Gurus has a lot options to choose from and their menu appeals to a lot of different tastes. However, we experienced some extremely slow and poor service.  Friends in our party received their food much faster than we did and people who had ordered after us also received their food before us. We had to go up and check on our order, which appeared to had been lost.  Additionally, they did not come around to refill water cups ever. They serve chips as a side with many dishes and give you a teeny tiny bit of dip/sauce. Very disappointing.

data.title: Not as good as I'd have liked
data.text: Met friends for lunch and I wasn't pleased. We were served the sweet potato fries right away then one member of the party got hers then the rest of us waited a good 10 min and then had to ask about our food which seemed like they forgot. My sandwich took another 5 minutes to arrive. It was a turkey sandwich on which one half had a very small hunk of turkey and then the other half had very little. It was supposed to have a creamy artichoke spread...guess they forgot. Clam chowder was descent. Won't be back and don't recommend.

data.title: Good, sometimes not worth the price.
data.text: I really like Gurus. Let's get one thing straight: they have the BEST sweet potato fries I have ever had. But, there other food is pretty mediocre. Sometimes I feel like I'm not getting what I paid for.

data.title: Not your typical Provo joint
data.text:
I've been to Gurus about 5 times from May through August so this review covers those recent visits. Guru's serves hearty portions of fusion foods and well-made basic deli orders. Vegetarian quesadillas are filled with sweet yellow curry, another popular quesadilla comes with pesto, and there are few regulars who leave without a large plate of fries (a small order is really enough for 2-3 people). 

Because of the vegetarian options and focus on local evening events (Wed, Thur, and Fri), the place attracts a refreshingly diverse crowd, unconventional for the area which is blocks from Brigham Young University.

data.title: Affordable and Good Food
data.text: We are in Provo for a month for work and we've been a frequent visitors to Guru's both for lunch or dinner and for the breakfast. It can't be beat and it's really affordable. They have a variety to pick from so everyone will be happy.

data.title: First time for lunch
data.text: Visited Guru's for lunch for first time today.  I usually eat at a restaurant I love when I'm in Provo, however, decided to let a friend choose where to go.  It was crowded, however, it was lunch....go figure.  The menu was unique and I loved all the options.   I chose lemon pepper salmon which came with squash and rice.  I don't eat rice and they were very nice to offer me extra vegetables.  Made my day!!  The lunch was excellent.  I found the staff to be very nice.  I will most definitely be returning!!

data.title: Excellent lunch!
data.text: Guru's doesn't disappoint! They have lots of options. I've been there a few times and it's always been delicious. The environment is fun and the location is convenient with lots of other fun things on center street. I would definitely recommend it!

data.title: My Favorite Restaurant
data.text: This place is by far my most favorite place to eat ever. The food is fresh and tastes so amazing. I adore the Southwest Chipotle Wrap and the Sweet Potato fries. You will too, don't worry! They offer vegetarian, gluten-free, healthy, and low-calorie dishes as well. Great desserts too. This place is popular with the locals and great for groups or a casual date. We've now moved from Provo to California, but when we visit I will definitely be showing up here!

data.title: Tasty and quick
data.text: Great food, quick counter service. Good vegetarian choices. Great location, coffee shop adjacent. Nice rustic building.

data.title: Cool design and good food
data.text: I had breakfast and dinner here. The restaurant is wonderfully designed, with lots of interesting features decking the ceiling and walls. The food was of a very high quality too, with lots of tempting options. I was sorry I didn't eat here more often during my stay in Provo, and recommend it highly to anyone visiting the town. It's only drawback is its limited drinking options.

data.title: Always a good stop
data.text: I've been in a couple of times for lunch and dates and have always been pleased. The food is always good, and the staff very helpful. It's a great spot for a fresh and bright meal, great alternative options for food allergies or diets as well. Not the cheapest or most filling but I've never been dissapointed.

data.title: Awesome place!
data.text: This is a really neat restauraunt. I like the different kinds of food they have to offer, and on Friday nights they have dance lessons for a half hour, and then you get to dance! These are the oldie dances, the swing, the two step, and so forth.

data.title: Great dinner
data.text:
We went to dinner with another couple tonight at gurus. The meal was excellent.  I had shrimp tacos and my wife had the Thai noodles. the other couple had something from the gluten free selections. I didn't try theirs but mine and my wife's were excellent. 

The staff was attentive and understands the meaning of service. We have been there three times now and have been impressed every time. 

It has a great menu of salads, sandwiches, noodles, soup's, Mexican, fish, pizzas, so far have we always found something we enjoy.  So many more meals to try I'm excited to go back for more

data.title: Great Lunch Quality Ingredients
data.text: I went there with my wife, daughter and her husband for lunch. I am a big fan of quality salads with quality meat, and this place did not disappoint.

data.title: Wonderful Burritos
data.text: I went to gurus once so far and it was great. Wonderful environment and service. The food was great and we all had a good time.

data.title: Great Gluten Free options
data.text: We stopped for lunch and was surprised to to see nice Gluten Free options for my daughter. Dodd was really good. We will definitely go back.

data.title: After the chocolate tasting
data.text: We shouldn't have been hungry after the chocolate tasting, but there are so many good places to eat in Provo, we decided to try Guru's.  All 6 of us tried something different and really liked our meals.  We shared potato fries and thought they were good. Lots of choices for food so recommend that folks try it out!

data.title: Delish!
data.text: Lots to choose from on the menu, but decided to get two salads - one full size, one half. Both were of good size and tasted great. Friendly staff, plenty of seating. On a nice day you can eat outside. And when you are done with your entree, just go through the opening to the bakery on the other side for dessert. Yummy!
